roleset.name: take on a new (usually bad) form

example.name: ARG0
example.text: The 275 trillion pounds of water from Hurricane Harvey deformed the ground in Texas.
example.arg: The 275 trillion pounds of water from Hurricane Harvey

example.name: deformation-n
example.text: If the glacier flows just by internal deformation, then it is likely that rates of creep decrease with depth, with fastest ice movement at the surface and slowest (or no) ice movement at the base and at the valley sides, where resistive stresses are highest (Jiskoot et al., 2011). Ice deforms because it is plastic.

example.name: deformed-j
example.text: The wall behind me was slightly deformed, but the center had held.

roleset.note: DEFORM-V NOTES: Frames file for 'deform' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry, Framenet entry Reshaping. (from deform.01-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: able to be reshaped

example.name: deformable-j: With end state
example.text: Tubular member deformable into a bellows for sealing a reciprocating rod
example.arg: into a bellows for sealing a reciprocating rod

example.name: deformable-j: medical
example.text: It was quite soft and deformable.

roleset.note: DEFORMABLE-J NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Slight comparison to deform.01-v. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from deformable.01-j)
